intro: Brighamia remyi, commonly known as the Brighamia, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It is a member of the Crambe family and is characterized by its unique, large, white, bell-shaped flowers. The plant is adapted to the dry, volcanic soils of its native habitat and is often found growing in coastal areas. Brighamia remyi is known for its striking appearance and is considered a rare and endangered species. Its conservation status highlights the importance of protecting its natural habitat from environmental threats.
